ygData.subject: Re: Practice Research Bugged?
ygData.msgSnippet: It s definetely bugged.  Last night I stuck an Enchanted Bar of Silver and an extra copy of the 1st book in and hit combine.  Guess what.  They don t combine
ygData.messageBody:
It's definetely bugged. Last night I stuck an Enchanted Bar of Silver and
an extra copy of the 1st book in and hit combine. Guess what. They don't
combine in these quantities. So, I won't be trying this again until I hear
from someone that the compendium has been fixed.

Wandatin Dai'Noga
24th level Gnomish Enchanter
Karana Server

----- Original Message -----
From: RINGI <RINGI@...>
To: <EQ_spell_research@onelist.com>
Sent: Thursday, July 29, 1999 7:10 PM
Subject: Re: [EQ_spell_research] Practice Research Bugged?


> From: "RINGI" <RINGI@...>
>
> Your Not alone I did the same thing. Tried the easy ones and got the same
> message. And like you I tried with and without the Quill and Perchment. Im
> really not suprised. Im still waiting for Invisablity to Blink for before
it
> goes.
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: Jon Carlstrom <carlstr@...>
> To: <EQ_spell_research@onelist.com>
> Sent: Thursday, July 29, 1999 7:14 AM
> Subject: [EQ_spell_research] Practice Research Bugged?
>
>
> > From: Jon Carlstrom <carlstr@...>
> >
> > Has anyone successfully attempted the new practice research implemented
> > in yesterdays patch? I did the minor quests, recived the recepie book
> > and the new book to combine items. So I thought I'd try the simplest
> > runes before using the rarer components in the harder runes.
> > Tried Rune 1: Lapiz Lazuli, Bat Wing, Bone Chip. Items fail to combine
> > in these quantities.
> > Ah, it mentioned needing a quill and parchment in the book. I buy both
> > at guild, and try the same. Items fail to combine in these quantities.
> >
> > So I try the next: Turquoise, Fire Beetle Eye, and a Rusty slashing
> > weapon. Same fail. Added quill and parchment, still same failure. Tried
> > many different slashing weapons. All fail.
> >
> > So is it buggy, and did Verant really add this whole new piece to
> > research without testing it in the slightest, even to attempt to make
> > one item? I have trouble believing even Verant would do that...so am I
> > missing something obvious? Would be interested to hear what kind of
> > success others have had with this new addition.
> >
> > Quil of Bertoxxulous
> >
> >
